alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 9:02PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cascade County through 930 PM MDT... At 902 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm near Great Falls, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Belt, Black Eagle, Armington, Ulm, Malmstrom Afb, Eden, Sand Coulee, Stockett, Tracy, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park and Centerville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
